newsitem.title: USA: HOT STOCKS HIGHLIGHTS- Corporate earnings.
newsitem.headline: HOT STOCKS HIGHLIGHTS- Corporate earnings.

text.p: Medaphis Corp off 36 percent or 6-1/8 to 10-5/8 in heavy trading.
The company posted a third quarter pro forma share loss of $0.51 compared to a loss of $0.05 and said it would restate 1995 earnings because of a license agreement with Imonics.
Avery Dennison Corp share rose 1-7/8 to 62-1/4 after hitting a new 52-week high of 62-3/4.
The company poasted earnings per share of $0.89 compared to $0.67 in the year-ago period and said it would seek a stock split and a dividend increase.
The company posted third quarter earnings of $0.85 on a fully diluted basis compared to $1.01 a share in the year-ago period. Sales for the quarter rose 9 percent to $1.6 billion.
Kimberly-Clark shares jump 2-1/4 to 89-7/8, a new 52 week high.
The company posted operating third quarter earnings of $1.24 compared to $1.15 in the year-ago quarter. It later said it expected a $200 million negative impact to 1996 results from tissue prices.
